image_analysis.description: A black and white scan of an open book, displaying two pages side-by-side. Page 152 is on the left and page 153 is on the right. The book's binding is visible in the center. The text appears to be from a non-fiction book or biography. A document control number is visible at the bottom of the image.
image_analysis.layout: Two-page spread from a book. Page 152 on the left contains the end of a chapter. Page 153 on the right begins 'CHAPTER 39'. Page numbers are at the bottom of each page. A document identifier is in the footer area of the overall image.

152

CHAPTER 39

Todd Meister: June 2015

Harry Cipriani, on Fifth Avenue, is a New York institu-
tion. The restaurant began its life as an American out-
post of Harry’s Bar—which was itself a famous American
outpost in Venice. Located inside the Sherry-Netherland hotel,
it’s a theme restaurant—the theme being money. And today, a
hedge-fund manager named Todd Meister is talking about a very
wealthy man—Jeffrey Epstein—whom he knows through his
father, Epstein’s sometime friend Bob Meister.
“I’ve known Jeffrey since I was nineteen,” Meister says. “So
let me tell you what I know—whatever everyone knows and
everybody else says. First off, he’s no billionaire. Second off—
and here’s why—he has no clue how to invest. He has people do
that for him.”
Meister knows how to invest. He does it for other people and, as
the son of a superrich father, for himself. He also knows about the

document_metadata.subject: An account by Todd Meister regarding his knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein, including his financial status and investment abilities.

notes: The text on the left page (152) is cut off at the beginning of each line, making it an incomplete fragment of a larger text. The text on the right page (153) appears to be the beginning of a new chapter.
